Posted By: samwisel88 (7/9/2011 9:58:22 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I used to wake up every day and think, "Man, life sucks, but at least I don't have smallpox!"  
  
So much for that... Anyway, the Time Spiral artwork was much better than this version, but whatever, I guess. The key with this card is to time it correctly. Does your opponent have only one card in hand? Cast it. Does your opponent only have one creature? Cast it. Does your opponent appear to be struggling to make land drops? Cast it. Is your opponent showing any combination of the aforementioned conditions? Cast it.  
  
The effect may seem underwhelming, but I guarantee you that you'll get a groan out of your opponent when you force them to sacrifice their last line of defense, discard their bomb they've been waiting to cast, and go down an additional land. It's no fun at all to be on the receiving end of that.
posts.html:
I used to wake up every day and think, "Man, life sucks, but at least I don't have smallpox!"

So much for that... Anyway, the Time Spiral artwork was much better than this version, but whatever, I guess. The key with this card is to time it correctly. Does your opponent have only one card in hand? Cast it. Does your opponent only have one creature? Cast it. Does your opponent appear to be struggling to make land drops? Cast it. Is your opponent showing any combination of the aforementioned conditions? Cast it.

The effect may seem underwhelming, but I guarantee you that you'll get a groan out of your opponent when you force them to sacrifice their last line of defense, discard their bomb they've been waiting to cast, and go down an additional land. It's no fun at all to be on the receiving end of that.

Hey, remember how you devoured all your creatures and hit me for 18? DIE.

4/5

posts.post_content:
T1: [Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth) or [Fetid Heath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fetid Heath)  
T2: [Flagstones of Trokair](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flagstones of Trokair), cast Smallpox, discard a [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast), sac the Flagstones and search for a Shockland; landfall triggers and Bloodghast is put on the battlefield.  
  
Basically, by Turn 2, they're down a card in hand, a land, and a creature.  
  
  
Oh, and 5/5.
posts.html:

Back when Zendikar was standard my friend ran a really great BW smallpox deck with [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast), [Squadron Hawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Squadron Hawk) and [Grim Discoveries](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Discoveries).

posts.html:
